pageContext.claim: “It meant something. When you had serious high crimes and misdemeanors when you had serious high crimes and misdemeanors, when you have serious crimes, it's impeachment. That would happen every 50 years, every 40 years, every hundred years.”
pageContext.analysis: The constitution did not suggest how frequently impeachment should take place. Impeachment proceedings in the United States have taken place three times in the last 45 years -- in 1974, in 1998 and now in 2019.
